comments.creator: jeanpierre.wenzel+mozilla-bugs@gmail.com
comments.author: jeanpierre.wenzel+mozilla-bugs@gmail.com
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0

Using the Google Contact Manager, I can add addresses to a specific contact but not delete them anymore.

The issue is present with 5.0 beta as well as 4.0.1.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open Google Contacts
2. Open an existing contact or create a new one
3. Create a new address entry
4. Try to delete that address entry

Actual Results:  
Address entry is not deleted.

Expected Results:  
Address entry should have been deleted.

comments.text:
Created attachment 540024
Google Contacts screenshot showing the delete button which is not working.

WFM on Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0rc

I was able to delete the address with backspace and also with the delete key. 
I was able to edit avery field and save the changes.

Could you see if the issue occurs if using an empty testing profile? (Don't install any addons into it)
http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Basic+Troubleshooting#w_8-make-a-new-profile

comments.creator: vlad.ghetiu@softvision.ro
comments.author: vlad.ghetiu@softvision.ro

comments.raw_text:
Vlad: what happens if you click on the trash can icon? The address entry should be deleted as a result (it does get deleted in Safari and Firefox 3.6.17, but neither in Firefox 4.0.1 nor 5.0).

Completely clearing the address entry field (as you described) works as a work-around.
comments.text:
Vlad: what happens if you click on the trash can icon? The address entry should be deleted as a result (it does get deleted in Safari and Firefox 3.6.17, but neither in Firefox 4.0.1 nor 5.0).

Completely clearing the address entry field (as you described) works as a work-around.

comments.raw_text: The problem is also present using a new, clean profile.
